name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Charleston North/University Area

reviews.text: We stayed at the Fairfield while visiting the Coastal Carolina Fair in Ladson. We already had family and friends staying there so we decided to stay there also. We got there late and was told that they only had King suites left but the wonderful clerk gave it to us for a great price.
reviews.title: Loved the Fairfield

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was immaculate! I'm one of those people that pulls the covers back to inspect the bed and inspect the bathroom before I will stay at a place, but this is I think the cleanest hotel room I've stayed in. Plenty of very comfortable pillows, spotless sheets and comforter. Bathroom looked like it had never been used.
reviews.title: Don't ever stay here!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were friendy, helpful and polite. breakfast was good but there is an Atlanta Bread Company restuarant right outside the front door, which is one of my favorites :)
reviews.title: Nice stay in North Charleston

reviews.text: I will definately stay there again and recommend it to my friends and family.
reviews.title: Better than most
Great Hotel
reviews.text: Our problem with Mariott began with the discovery of the dirty and unhealthy state of our room at exactly 10pm on July 21, 2007. On contacting the front desk, the lady at the front desk, Dee Garza rudely informed us that nothing will be done to save our situation except we choose to come down to the front desk and collect new sheets and towels for our rooms after which we are supposed to now return to the rooms and basically perfom the job functions of Mariott housekeepers. Room service we were told leave the hotel premises everyday at about 5pm. We left our hotel room at about 11am the same day allowing room service six full hours in which they were supposed to clean our room before our return. This never happened. We politely asked Ms Garza for the telephone number to her immiediate supervisor in which she responded that she did not have an immediate supervisor. We also asked that she provide us with contact information to the Managers of the facility. That request also met a brickwall. She referred us to call a sales representative, someone who neither has a clue about customer grievance nor manages the problems that customers confront when they stay at Mariott hotels.

I recently stayed for work at this hotel. It was wonderful, every staff member from front desk, to maintenence, to housekeeping and beyond was extremely nice, they always greeted me with a smile and a good morning/afternoon or whatever time of day it was. When my stay got extended by my job, it was very simple to get a new reservation and check Back in. The room was spacious and met my needs, all except more outlets or better access to outlets would be an improvement to the room I was in.. otherwise it was a very comfortable stay. I will be staying again this next week, again for business. And I look forward to using this hotel or sister properties in the future!!!
reviews.title: Very impressed!!!

reviews.text: The hotel staff was rude. There would always be some error in billing. I would be overcharged and then I had to go and get it corrected.
reviews.title: Nightmare

reviews.text: Fridge in room wouldn't work. Bad air conditioning as well as unclean pool..
reviews.title: Poor service, Overpriced, and the room was falling apart

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Never again.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff\Clean Rooms

reviews.text: Short and sweet review: the room was tiny, service was rude, and minimal. When time I needed to go to the desk about fixing the bathroom door handle that fell off, and for a rew extra pillows, i was waiting for half an hour each time. Room was not clean because I found a pair of dirty old slippers under the bed... I've stayed at the hotel across the street from this one, and it was exponentally better!!! don't let the lobby fool you
reviews.title: INCREDIBLE PLACE TO STAY!!!!

reviews.text: Despite some iffy reviews, we chose to stay at this hotel because of an excellent deal available through one of the travel websites. (Significantly cheaper than the hotel's own website, by the way.). The location is not bad at all, just off the interstate that leads west out of Charleston, and in an area that has restaurants, stores, etc. It was not at all noisy outside, nor did it seem unsafe.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for a family stay, at less than 50% of what you'd pay downtown (and what a buffet!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found that the hotel was clean, both in public areas and in our room. Our beds and bed linens were very comfortable, and the bathroom was spacious and well-lit. The check-in was fast and efficient, and our overnight stay was without problems. I did note that the floors between rooms must be wood, rather than cement, since I could hear footsteps from above. A stay on the top floor would remedy this problem, as others have noted.
reviews.title: Worst hotel experience

reviews.text: Our biggest and most pleasant surprise was the breakfast buffet. The food was tasty and fresh, and constantly replenished. The woman working there (Jesel) was probably the single best worker of this sort that we've encountered. She was pleasant to everyone, had a great and welcoming smile, and kept the entire area SPOTLESS. After seeing a wide range of customer service representatives all around the world, we know what's good and what's not. Jesel was responsible for creating a very good impression in the eyes of many holiday visitors. I hope that other TripAdvisor members will take note of this positive and honest review. I hope that hotel managers who read this will recognize the value that just one good employee can have (as well as understanding how one bad apple can damage the entire enterprise).
reviews.title: Convenient, Clean, Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel needs new mattresses, bed was most uncomfortable. Breakfast service was not the best. At 8 AM they said all the fruit have been served and there isn't any more. Also they have no more complimentary newspaper. Staff has terrible attitude.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, THIN WALLS and CEILINGS

reviews.text: Good weekend stay. Would stay again. Breakfast was OK. Parking good. Lbath in our room. Daily housekeeping. courteois staff.
reviews.title: Clean, comfortable, looks new, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel, along with 10 others, during April 2012 as part of a 17 day road trip across GA, NC, SC. By giving the star rating I am not saying the hotel is a 4 star but whether it was clean and value for the money and to an extent we have compared then to the other 10 hotels we stayed at.
reviews.title: very good

reviews.text: Unlike some others this Fairfield Inn was more like a traditional hotel hotel were you park as near the reception as possible and take your luggage through the reception to a lift to your room. This felt much safer to us than the motel types were your room door is accessible to all from the street.
reviews.title: Excellent housekeeping and hospitality!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was top notch for cleanliness and standard of furnishings. Clean towels and lots of hot water.
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.text: The included breakfast was pretty good with a good choice. A bit of jostling as the service area was quite small for the number of guests but there was a good sized seating area so we did not feel cramped as in most other places.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel - not so great breakfast

reviews.text: At about £62 per night this was one of the better hotels that we stayed at provided that the location is OK for you. It was in North Charleston which is about 20 miles or so from Charleston.
reviews.title: Clean & nothing special

aka: Fairfield Inn & Suites Charleston North / Elms Hotel North Charleston
